27  package org.apache.http.client.cache;
28  
29  import static org.easymock.classextension.EasyMock.createNiceMock;
30  import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
31  import static org.junit.Assert.assertFalse;
32  import static org.junit.Assert.assertNotNull;
33  import static org.junit.Assert.assertNull;
34  import static org.junit.Assert.assertSame;
35  import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
36  import static org.junit.Assert.fail;
37  
38  import java.util.Date;
39  import java.util.HashMap;
40  import java.util.Map;
41  
42  import org.apache.http.Header;
43  import org.apache.http.HttpStatus;
44  import org.apache.http.HttpVersion;
45  import org.apache.http.StatusLine;
46  import org.apache.http.client.utils.DateUtils;
47  import org.apache.http.message.BasicHeader;
48  import org.apache.http.message.BasicStatusLine;
49  import org.junit.Before;
50  import org.junit.Test;
51  
52  public class TestHttpCacheEntry {
53  
54      private Date now;
55      private Date elevenSecondsAgo;
56      private Date nineSecondsAgo;
57      private Resource mockResource;
58      private StatusLine statusLine;
59      private HttpCacheEntry entry;
60  
61      @Before
62      public void setUp() {
63          now = new Date();
64          elevenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 11 * 1000L);
65          nineSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 9 * 1000L);
66          statusLine = new BasicStatusLine(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
67                  HttpStatus.SC_OK, "OK");
68          mockResource = createNiceMock(Resource.class);
69      }
70  
71      private HttpCacheEntry makeEntry(final Header[] headers) {
72          return new HttpCacheEntry(elevenSecondsAgo, nineSecondsAgo,
73                  statusLine, headers, mockResource);
74      }
75  
76      @Test
77      public void testGetHeadersReturnsCorrectHeaders() {
78          final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("foo", "fooValue"),
79                  new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue1"),
80                  new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue2")
81          };
82          entry = makeEntry(headers);
83          assertEquals(2, entry.getHeaders("bar").length);
84      }
85  
86      @Test
87      public void testGetFirstHeaderReturnsCorrectHeader() {
88          final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("foo", "fooValue"),
89                  new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue1"),
90                  new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue2")
91          };
92          entry = makeEntry(headers);
93          assertEquals("barValue1", entry.getFirstHeader("bar").getValue());
94      }
95  
96      @Test
97      public void testGetHeadersReturnsEmptyArrayIfNoneMatch() {
98          final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("foo", "fooValue"),
99                  new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue1"),
100                 new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue2")
101         };
102         entry = makeEntry(headers);
103         assertEquals(0, entry.getHeaders("baz").length);
104     }
105 
106     @Test
107     public void testGetFirstHeaderReturnsNullIfNoneMatch() {
108         final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("foo", "fooValue"),
109                 new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue1"),
110                 new BasicHeader("bar", "barValue2")
111         };
112         entry = makeEntry(headers);
113         assertEquals(null, entry.getFirstHeader("quux"));
114     }
115 
116     @Test
117     public void testCacheEntryWithNoVaryHeaderDoesNotHaveVariants() {
118         final Header[] headers = new Header[0];
119         entry = makeEntry(headers);
120         assertFalse(entry.hasVariants());
121     }
122 
123     @Test
124     public void testCacheEntryWithOneVaryHeaderHasVariants() {
125         final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("Vary", "User-Agent") };
126         entry = makeEntry(headers);
127         assertTrue(entry.hasVariants());
128     }
129 
130     @Test
131     public void testCacheEntryWithMultipleVaryHeadersHasVariants() {
132         final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("Vary", "User-Agent"),
133                 new BasicHeader("Vary", "Accept-Encoding")
134         };
135         entry = makeEntry(headers);
136         assertTrue(entry.hasVariants());
137     }
138 
139     @Test
140     public void testCacheEntryWithVaryStarHasVariants(){
141         final Header[] headers = { new BasicHeader("Vary", "*") };
142         entry = makeEntry(headers);
143         assertTrue(entry.hasVariants());
144     }
145 
146     @Test
147     public void mustProvideRequestDate() {
148         try {
149             new HttpCacheEntry(null, new Date(), statusLine,
150                     new Header[]{}, mockResource);
151             fail("Should have thrown exception");
152         } catch (final IllegalArgumentException expected) {
153         }
154     }
155 
156     @Test
157     public void mustProvideResponseDate() {
158         try {
159             new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), null, statusLine,
160                     new Header[]{}, mockResource);
161             fail("Should have thrown exception");
162         } catch (final IllegalArgumentException expected) {
163         }
164     }
165 
166     @Test
167     public void mustProvideStatusLine() {
168         try {
169             new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), null,
170                     new Header[]{}, mockResource);
171             fail("Should have thrown exception");
172         } catch (final IllegalArgumentException expected) {
173         }
174     }
175 
176     @Test
177     public void mustProvideResponseHeaders() {
178         try {
179             new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
180                     null, mockResource);
181             fail("Should have thrown exception");
182         } catch (final IllegalArgumentException expected) {
183         }
184     }
185 
186     @Test
187     public void canRetrieveOriginalStatusLine() {
188         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
189                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
190         assertSame(statusLine, entry.getStatusLine());
191     }
192 
193     @Test
194     public void protocolVersionComesFromOriginalStatusLine() {
195         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
196                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
197         assertSame(statusLine.getProtocolVersion(),
198                 entry.getProtocolVersion());
199     }
200 
201     @Test
202     public void reasonPhraseComesFromOriginalStatusLine() {
203         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
204                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
205         assertSame(statusLine.getReasonPhrase(), entry.getReasonPhrase());
206     }
207 
208     @Test
209     public void statusCodeComesFromOriginalStatusLine() {
210         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
211                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
212         assertEquals(statusLine.getStatusCode(), entry.getStatusCode());
213     }
214 
215     @Test
216     public void canGetOriginalRequestDate() {
217         final Date requestDate = new Date();
218         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(requestDate, new Date(), statusLine,
219                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
220         assertSame(requestDate, entry.getRequestDate());
221     }
222 
223     @Test
224     public void canGetOriginalResponseDate() {
225         final Date responseDate = new Date();
226         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), responseDate, statusLine,
227                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
228         assertSame(responseDate, entry.getResponseDate());
229     }
230 
231     @Test
232     public void canGetOriginalResource() {
233         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
234                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
235         assertSame(mockResource, entry.getResource());
236     }
237 
238     @Test
239     public void canGetOriginalHeaders() {
240         final Header[] headers = {
241                 new BasicHeader("Server", "MockServer/1.0"),
242                 new BasicHeader("Date", DateUtils.formatDate(now))
243         };
244         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
245                 headers, mockResource);
246         final Header[] result = entry.getAllHeaders();
247         assertEquals(headers.length, result.length);
248         for(int i=0; i<headers.length; i++) {
249             assertEquals(headers[i], result[i]);
250         }
251     }
252 
253     @Test
254     public void canConstructWithoutVariants() {
255         new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
256                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
257     }
258 
259     @Test
260     public void canProvideVariantMap() {
261         new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
262                 new Header[]{}, mockResource,
263                 new HashMap<String,String>());
264     }
265 
266     @Test
267     public void canRetrieveOriginalVariantMap() {
268         final Map<String,String> variantMap = new HashMap<String,String>();
269         variantMap.put("A","B");
270         variantMap.put("C","D");
271         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
272                 new Header[]{}, mockResource,
273                 variantMap);
274         final Map<String,String> result = entry.getVariantMap();
275         assertEquals(2, result.size());
276         assertEquals("B", result.get("A"));
277         assertEquals("D", result.get("C"));
278     }
279 
280     @Test
281     public void retrievedVariantMapIsNotModifiable() {
282         final Map<String,String> variantMap = new HashMap<String,String>();
283         variantMap.put("A","B");
284         variantMap.put("C","D");
285         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
286                 new Header[]{}, mockResource,
287                 variantMap);
288         final Map<String,String> result = entry.getVariantMap();
289         try {
290             result.remove("A");
291             fail("Should have thrown exception");
292         } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException expected) {
293         }
294         try {
295             result.put("E","F");
296             fail("Should have thrown exception");
297         } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException expected) {
298         }
299     }
300 
301     @Test
302     public void canConvertToString() {
303         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
304                 new Header[]{}, mockResource);
305         assertNotNull(entry.toString());
306         assertFalse("".equals(entry.toString()));
307     }
308 
309     @Test
310     public void testMissingDateHeaderIsIgnored() {
311         final Header[] headers = new Header[] {};
312         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
313                                    headers, mockResource);
314         assertNull(entry.getDate());
315     }
316 
317     @Test
318     public void testMalformedDateHeaderIsIgnored() {
319         final Header[] headers = new Header[] { new BasicHeader("Date", "asdf") };
320         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
321                                    headers, mockResource);
322         assertNull(entry.getDate());
323     }
324 
325     @Test
326     public void testValidDateHeaderIsParsed() {
327         final long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
328         // round down to nearest second to make comparison easier
329         final Date date = new Date(now - (now % 1000L));
330         final Header[] headers = new Header[] { new BasicHeader("Date", DateUtils.formatDate(date)) };
331         entry = new HttpCacheEntry(new Date(), new Date(), statusLine,
332                                    headers, mockResource);
333         final Date dateHeaderValue = entry.getDate();
334         assertNotNull(dateHeaderValue);
335         assertEquals(date.getTime(), dateHeaderValue.getTime());
336     }
337 
338 }
